reviews.text: This is a great museum of primarily southern Illinois history. Not an overly large space but the creative and inspired work of curated displays means that this museum does not suffer from cramped surroundings due to trying to display too much of their collections. If you will be visiting check out the North hall's Swedlund photography including pics from the region. They are incredible. Artwork from the Depression era can be found in the South hall. Allow yourself enough time to get through both halls. You won't be disappointed.
A fun free way to spend a few hours with a great collection

What a very special place to visit here in Carbondale!!  It's the entire building of fanner that is at first awesome and inspiring.then the actual art inside of the place. From time to time I like to take a  visit to the museum and stay for a few hours relaxing and just taking it all in. The building of fanner is almost a world wonder.the amount of education and learning is a gift from the universe!!!!Great place for alone time or for being in   a room full of people. It's a sure to please experience EVERY TIME. I HOPE MY GREAT GREAT GRABD KIDS AREE BL EESSED WITH TTHE ABILITY TO TAJE ADVANTAGE OF ALL THAT SIU gas to offer !!!!!!
This museum has a very good collection of art and items with historical significance. I highly recommend it for locals and visitors alike!
